channel.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
channel.description:
ok i like both but my friends are always trying to convice me that Metal Gear Solid 4 is better
what is better?

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
I’d recommend you NEVER go to the “MGS: The Unofficial Site” forums then.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: Dust
item.description:
MGS2 in my opinion was awful compared to the first one.

At the end of MGS1, I thought of many places the story could go…but it came up with some stupid thing that made little sense in comparison to the first one.
Also the concept of being on the “oil-platform” was flawed…the connecting bridges were annoying as hell.

MGS3 was a great improvement, with a great story and brilliant setting.

MGS4 is too combat heavy. You don’t have to fight, but you can. Put that along with the poor bosses and bad pacing…
Don’t get me wrong, it was a great game…but not too great.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
Let’s see:
1.) They’re both in completely different genres.
2.) They’re both great in their own ways
3.) I have not played Uncharted 2 yet, but I am playing Uncharted 1 and enjoying it very much.
4.) My Metal Gear fanboyism is telling me to yell “MGS4 FTW!!! Fuck that gay ass Uncharted!” But I’ll restrain myself.
4.) I admit that the story gets fucking retarded at some points (see: Liquid’s Arm. WTF?!), but that’s part of the game’s appeal to me.

Someonerandm:

To each his own. I just oppose it because I think a game needs to be a game, not a movie.

You’re ignorance is stunning. If you’re going to make an argument, have a real argument. And if you don’t have one, don’t post.
Not every game can be like Half-Life where you’re in control 100%. Though it would be great if it was, it would be very hard for some stories to be told 100% in game.
Besides, at least you can skip them. In Half-Life (and it’s sequels), you’re forced to take part in these scripted sequences even after you beat the game, whether you care about stories in video games or not. Why you would WANT to skip ANY part of Half-Life’s story is beyond me, but to each his own I guess.

Kairouseki:

MGS2 was probably my least favorite MGS title actually. I mean, you didn’t even get to play as Snake except for the first 20 minutes.

I disagree completely. MGS2 is my favorite MGS game.
The themes the game was trying to convey were well executed and thought provoking, and playing as Raiden gave you a new perspective to the story.

But when it comes to being epic, MGS4 takes the cake.

And to whoever thought up the idea of a separate part of the forums for pointless debate topics:

Read full topic

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: Garcian_Smith
item.description:
I disagree. Whist MGS4 has some standout moments, it’s story becomes quickly convoluted. It’s characters aren’t particularly interesting, either - with, like I say, only a few occasional standouts (Snake, Johnny and Meryl for example). Uncharted 2 was a breath of fresh air, with a fast moving script, great characterisation (apart from the rent-a-psycho) and some of the finest action sequences I’ve ever witnessed.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: Officerseal
item.description:
-MGS4 if you want heavy story (an amazing story at that)
-Uncharted 2 if you want an action game.

I would take MGS4 because it’s not only a great game, but a great story. I think MGS is the only other game series that can even come close to the Half-Life series in terms of telling a story.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
MGS2 was probably my least favorite MGS title actually. I mean, you didn’t even get to play as Snake except for the first 20 minutes. Though the end was pretty cool, I prefer the end to MGS4, especially the last battle and the little bit before it. I also love the title screen :retard: .

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
MGS4 is strictly for those who played the other 3.
And honestly, 4 sucked compared to 3 and 2.
MGS2 is still the best MGS to date.

But that’s irrelevant.
If you simply want to have fun, buy Uncharted.

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: jonegomes
item.description:
Actually I like both, I only played the co-op in the full version of the product about once, 1 survival mode. I’ll need to find time to start digging into it. I’m sure it’s great. Uncharted 2 is probably one of the most important games for the PS3. Little Big Planet, MGS4, and Uncharted 2, I’d say. We’ll add GOW3 and GT5 to that list if they turn out.One thing that you can’t deny about the PS3 is that it has some damn good exclusives. Just like you can’t deny the 360’s damn good online service (even with that cost). Great to see that they are keeping the game alive.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncharted 2 VS. MGS4
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
SwampFox56:

ok i like both but my friends are always trying to convice me that Metal Gear Solid 4 is better

what is better?

Let me answer your question with another question: Is toast better than a Mercedes SLK?

Seems like a silly comparison? That’s because MGS4 and Uncharted 2 are completely different games. One is a heavily plot-driven miniseries, made up of 16 hours of cutscenes interspersed with 12 seconds of gameplay, whereas Uncharted 2 is a Prince of Persia/Indiana Jones platforming hybrid. If you like climbing cliffs, listening to witty dialogue and trekking through the Amazon, then go for Uncharted 2. If you like FPS-stealth type games, then go for MGS4, but its really a personal choice and no objective standard could ever compare the two.

Read full topic
